titleStmt.title: By the King. A proclamation charging all Iesuites, seminaries, &c. to depart the land.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1603-1625 : James I)
James I, King of England, 1566-1625.

publicationStmt.publisher: by Bonham Norton and Iohn Bill, printers to the Kings most excellent Maiestie,

notesStmt.note: "On the petition of Parliament, all Jesuits, Seminary Priests, and persons in Romish Orders are to leave England before 14th June next on pain of punishment by law. No one to harbour them. All Archbishops, Judges, &c., to be vigilant in execution of this." -- Steele.
Dated at end: ... Greenewich, the sixt day of May, in the two and twentieth yeere of His Maiesties reigne ... .
Steele notation: knowledge, within 2) behalfe they; Arms 12
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
